name: Ray Race Jr. Writing Style
core_principles: Use active voice (I completed, I resolved, I implemented)
Be specific and quantify when possible
Focus on what was accomplished, not just worked on
Keep bullets concise (under 20 words when possible)
Be honest about blockers and challenges
Use technical terms accurately but explain when needed

sentence_structure: Lead with the outcome or deliverable
Use action verbs (completed, implemented, resolved, identified)
formatting: Use numbered lists for sequential items or questions
Bold for emphasis on key deliverables
language: Internal reports can be more technical

avoid: Starting with 'I worked on' (focus on outcome instead)

deliverables.focus: What was delivered, not what was worked on

in_progress.format: Task description + current status + next steps

blockers.focus: What is blocked and what's needed to unblock

good_examples.text: Completed SSO integration with Azure AD, enabling secure authentication for 500+ users
good_examples.why_good: Starts with completion, shows scope (500+ users), clear outcome

good_examples.text: Resolved critical authentication bug affecting login flow, restoring service for all users
good_examples.why_good: Action verb, specific issue, clear impact

good_examples.text: Continuing security audit - completed network layer, next: application layer review
good_examples.why_good: Shows progress, current status, next steps

good_examples.text: Blocked on client API credentials - deployment scheduled for Monday depends on receiving keys
good_examples.why_good: Clear blocker, impact stated, urgency implied

good_examples.text: Implemented multi-factor authentication, reducing unauthorized access risk by 95%
good_examples.why_good: Business value, quantified benefit, non-technical language

bad_examples.text: Worked on the authentication system today
bad_examples.why_bad: No outcome, no specifics, no value shown

bad_examples.text: A fix was implemented for the payment bug
bad_examples.why_bad: Passive voice, no ownership, no context
Just activity, no outcome or decisions

bad_examples.text: Refactored OAuth2 PKCE flow to support refresh token rotation
bad_examples.why_bad: Technical jargon without business context for client

bad_examples.text: Just managed to get the login working, tried my best

always_include: Use active voice and action verbs
Focus on completed work and deliverables
daily_internal_specific: Can use technical terms - internal audience
Be direct about challenges and blockers
formatting_instructions: Each bullet should be one concise line (under 20 words preferred)
Use sub-items (a., b., c.) for weekly client reports
No bold, italics, or excessive formatting

output_when_no_data.guidance: Use simple, direct statements. Don't apologize for having no items.
